data.contentText:
Think - is this really Meconium aspiration?
Just because there was meconium at delivery doesn't mean it was aspirated! 
Most aspiration occurs in utero before the baby is born, so more likely if there was foetal distress

Babies with mec aspiration are sick with significant respiratory distress and may have signs of birth asphyxia. Floppy babies with severe HIE and Meconium aspiration are unlikely to benefit from CPAP.

metadata.text1:
- Position airway & suction
- If sats < 90% in air put on oxygen
- If > 1kg consider CPAP according to TRY-CPAP algorithm
metadata.text2:
- If breathing 60-80 bpm use cup/NGT
- If needing CPAP use OGT
- If breathing > 80 bpm consider IV fluids

data.title: MANAGEMENT
